./.title: Overview
./.body:
What can I find here?
Hi, welcome to TicKTick!

This guide is divided into six chapters to help you understand the features of TickTick.



Chapter
Content




Chapter 1
About TickTick


Chapter 2
TickTick Web version


Chapter 3
TickTick Android app


Chapter 4
TicKTick iOS app


Chapter 5
Chrome Extension


Chapter 6
Video Tutorials


Chapter 7
Filter


Chapter 8
Smart Date Parsing



Feel free to contact us if you have any further questions that are not mentioned here. You may also create a discussion thread at TickTick Help Center or email us directly support@ticktick.com.

Would you like to help us with translation?
We are determined to make TickTick a multi-language app. If you are willing to contribute for part of the translation work, please contact us via email. See below for more information:
English, Russian, Korean, Hebrew, French, Germany, Italian, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, Slovak, Ukrainian, Spanish, Hungarian, Portuguese, Dutch, Czech, Japanese, Polish 
Some of the languages above are available only on specific platforms, Let us know if you could help us do better!

what_is_ticktick.html.title: What is TickTick?
what_is_ticktick.html.body:
What is TickTick?
TickTick is a simple and effective to-do list & task management app that helps you organize your life at work, home and everywhere else.
Add tasks anytime, anywhere!

Check tasks one by one!

View and manage your agenda with calendar!

Get reminded based on time & location!

Multiple themes for individual taste!

Discover more powerful features with TickTick!

which_device_is_needed_to_use_ticktick.h.title: What platforms are available?
which_device_is_needed_to_use_ticktick.h.body:
TickTick for phones, tablets, and computers.
TickTick is available on the web, Android phone, Android wear, Window, iPhone, iPad, Mac, Apple Watch, Chrome Extension and Firefox plugin. With 10+ platforms, you can check your tasks whereever you are, whenever you want to.

is_ticktick_free.html.title: What is TickTick Premium?
is_ticktick_free.html.body:
What is TickTick Premium?
Boost up your productivity with TickTick Premium for $2.79 per month or $27.99 per year.
 Premium account has full access to features such as:




Features




1
Lists  (299)


2
Tasks of each list (999)


3
Subtasks of each task (199)


4
Recipients for each shared list (19)


5
Attachments (99 per day)


6
Calendar Subscription (3 for account sub/3 for URL sub)


7
Calendar View


8
Task Activities




 On the web, Premium users can also enjoy the following features in "Labs":




Feature




1
Task Duplication


2
Mini Calendar




 Most of TickTick features are free, but free account has the following limits:

does_ticktick_have_an_api.html.title: Does TickTick have an API?
does_ticktick_have_an_api.html.body:
Does TickTick have an API?
Yes, TickTick for Android has an API doc available for anyone who wants to integrate other apps with TickTick. The API doc can be read here: https://gist.github.com/jackinside/22dd1ed1011403646d6a.

how_can_i_get_refund.html.title: How can I get refund?
how_can_i_get_refund.html.body:
How to cancel my subscription? What about refund?
Refunds are available within 14 days after the purchase. If you upgraded with Android or Web, please provide your TickTick account and transaction ID to support@ticktick.com with a refund request. If you upgraded with iOS, you will need to ask Apple for refund because of the Apple's limits. Here is the link to report your request to Apple: https://reportaproblem.apple.com/ 
Meanwhile, you should cancel the subscription from the platform where you purchased TickTick to ensure that you'll not be charged again.
Paypal:
You can enter PayPal to cancel your subscription:
https://www.paypal.com/c2/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_manage-paylist
iOS:
You can cancel your subscription in App Store by:

Scroll down the screen and tap your Apple ID at the bottom.
Tap "View Apple ID".
Tap "Subscription" and choose TickTick.
Tap "Cancel Subscription".

Android:
You can cancel your subscription in Play Store by:
Tap "Account" in sidebar.
Tap "Subscriptions", then find TickTick to cancel.

1.1.1/Preference settings.html.title: How to change themes?
1.1.1/Preference settings.html.body:
How to change themes?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of TickTick homepage, then click "Settings" from the menu that appears.

Click "Themes" in the left panel, then choose colors and themes in the right panel.

how_to_set_language_in_ticktick.html.title: How to set TickTick's language?
how_to_set_language_in_ticktick.html.body:
How to set TickTick's language

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of your TickTick homepage, then click "Settings" from the menu that appears.

Choose a language in the "Language" option on the right panel.


P.S. If your language does not appear in the list, and you want to help us do translation work in your language, clicking "Your language is not available?" at the bottom of the drop-down menu. This opens a new tab where you can click "Help us translate" to complete a form. Upon submission of the form, we will contact you soon.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_set_time_format..title: How to set time format?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_set_time_format..body:
How to set time format?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of your TickTick homepage, then click "Settings" from the menu that appears.

In the "Time Format" section, select "12 Hour" or "24 Hour".


How is time format used in TickTick?
Time format is most relevant to your due dates.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_set_the_start_of.title: How to set the start day of the week?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_set_the_start_of.body:
How to set the first day of the week?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of your TickTick homepage, then click "Settings" from the menu that appears. 

From the "Start Week On" drop-down menu, choose Saturday, Sunday, or Monday as the first day of the week in TickTick.



Where is it used?

Due date calendar


Mini calendar (see section 2.7.4 for details)

ticktick_web_app/how_to_set_daily_alert_.title: What is Daily Alert?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_set_daily_alert_.body:
What is "Daily Alert" ?
A Daily Alert is a daily reminder summarizing all your overdue and today's tasks, and you set the time of day when you wish to receive this reminder.
How to set daily alert time?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of your TickTick homepage, then click "Settings" from the menu that appears. 

In the "Daily Alert Time" section, set a time when you would like your daily reminder to occur.


If you set "Daily Alert Time" at 9:00 AM, you will receive a notification at 9:00 AM every day with a summary of all your overdue & today’s tasks.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_upload_your_prof.title: How to upload profile image?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_upload_your_prof.body:
How to upload profile image?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of your TickTick homepage, then click "Settings" from the menu that appears.

Click "Profile" in the left panel.

Click the avatar to upload a profile image.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_change_the_email.title: How to change the email address of my account?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_change_the_email.body:
How to change the email address of my account?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of your TickTick homepage, then click "Settings" from the menu that appears.

Click "Profile" in the left panel.

Click "Change Email" right next to your current email address and you will be prompted to enter a new email address.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_change_password..title: How to change password?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_change_password..body:
How to change password?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of your TickTick homepage, then click "Settings" from the menu that appears.

Click "Profile" in the left panel.

Click "Change Password" in the right panel.

Enter your current password, then enter your new password.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_delete_your_acco.title: How to delete my account?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_delete_your_acco.body:
How to delete my account?
Are you sure you want to delete your account? We feel sorry that you wish to leave us.
You are always welcome to contact us if you have any questions, comments, or issues with TickTick.

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of your TickTick homepage, then click "Settings" from the menu that appears. 

Click "Profile" in the left panel.

Click the "Delete account" button.


Deleting your account will remove all your data from TickTick. To help prevent against an unintended loss of information, you will be asked to confirm your TickTick password before proceeding. If you have forgotten your password, reset your password first and then delete your account. You may make a backup file of your TickTick data for future use (see section 2.3.1).

how_to_generate_&_import_data.html.title: How to generate & import data?
how_to_generate_&_import_data.html.body:
How to generate and import data?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of your TickTick homepage, then click "Settings" from the menu that appears.

Click "Backup" in the left panel, then click "Generate Backup" in the right panel to save your backup as a CSV file.


By clicking "Import Backup", you can import backups generated from TickTick.

how_to_import_data_from_other_apps.html.title: How to import data from other apps?
how_to_import_data_from_other_apps.html.body:
How to import tasks from other apps to TickTick?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of your TickTick homepage, then click "Settings" from the menu that appears.

Click "Backup" in the left panel.


TickTick allows you to import tasks from other to-do apps, including Wunderlist, Omnifocus, Astrid, Toodledo, Springpad, and iCal.

how_to_upgrade_to_pro.html.title: How to upgrade to Premium?
how_to_upgrade_to_pro.html.body:
How to upgrade to Premium?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of your TickTick homepage, then click "Settings" from the menu that appears. 

Click "Premium Account" in the left panel.

Click "Upgrade to PREMIUM".

Choose a monthly or annual subscription to complete your payment via Paypal.


You can also subscribe to TickTick Premium on your mobile app via "Google Wallet" or "iTunes", according to your device.

Can I cancel the subscription anytime?
Yes, you can cancel the subscription anytime.
If you cancel the Premium subscription within 14 days, you can get a refund (see section 1.6 for details).
If you cancel the subscription after 14 days, refund are no longer available. The subscription will last until the end of the month or year, depending on which type of Premium account you purchased. Once Premium expires, your account will be downgraded to a free account.

If I have more than 19 lists, will I lose your lists and tasks after my account is downgraded to a free one?
Free accounts get a maximum of 19 lists. Premium accounts can have up to 99 lists. For additional features in TickTick, please turn to 1.4). If you have 25 lists and your account is downgraded, your data (lists, tasks, images, etc.) won't be lost, but you are not allowed to add more, because you have already exceeded the upper limit for free account.

how_to_redeem_a_ticktick_gift_code.html.title: How to redeem a TickTick gift code?
how_to_redeem_a_ticktick_gift_code.html.body:
How to redeem a TickTick gift code?
If you have a TickTick gift code, please redeem it with TickTick on the web. Here's how to do it:

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of your TickTick homepage, then click "Settings" from the menu that appears.

Click "Smart List" in the left panel, then enable "Custom Smart List " in the right panel

Click "Redeem" and enter your gift code.


P.S. If you already have a Premium account, please redeem the gift code after your Premium account expires.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_add_a_new_list.h.title: How to create a new list?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_add_a_new_list.h.body:
How to create a new list?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click "Create New List" in the sidebar.

Enter a list name and choose a color for your new list.

how_to_create_custom_smart_list.html.title: How to create Custom Smart List?
how_to_create_custom_smart_list.html.body:
How to create a Custom Smart List? (Premium)
In order to create Custom Smart Lists on the web, you should first enable "Custom Smart List" by:

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click "Settings", then "Smart List" in the left panel, then enable "Custom Smart List" in the right panel.

Click "Custom" in left side bar to add a Custom Smart List. The created Custom Smart List will appear in the "Custom" section in the sidebar.


Click "Custom" in left side bar to add a Custom Smart List. The created Custom Smart List will appear in the "Custom" section in the sidebar.

how_to_create_a_list_folder.html.title: How to create a list folder?
how_to_create_a_list_folder.html.body:
How to create a list folder?
With Folders, organizing your lists is as simple as drag-and-drop.

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Drag a list on top of another one that you would like to include in the same folder.

Hover your list over the list you want to be stored in the same folder, until a blue box appears around that list.

Drop the chosen list by releasing the mouse button, and then name the folder.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_edit_lists.html.title: How to edit a list/folder?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_edit_lists.html.body:
How to edit a list/folder?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the "···" which is located near a list/folder name.

Select "Edit".

Change list/folder name, etc.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_share_lists.html.title: How to share lists with TickTick users?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_share_lists.html.body:
How to share lists with other TickTick users?
There are two ways to share lists.
Option 1:

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the "..." icon in the upper-right corner of the middle panel, then click "Share".


Type an email address into the text field to add a recipient, and press enter to send an email notification to your recipient prompting them to accept your invitation to share the list.



Option 2:Share via link

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the "···" icon in the upper-right corner of the middle panel, then click "Share".

Click the "Enable Link" option to reveal a link that you can copy and use another app (for example, Gmail) to send the link to other TickTick users.




Do I need to be a Premium user to join shared lists?
No, it is not necessary to upgrade to Premium to join a shared list. Recipients are always free to join shared lists.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_print_a_list.htm.title: How to print a list?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_print_a_list.htm.body:
How to print a list?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the "···" icon in the upper-right corner of the middle panel, then click "Print".

Choose whether to print the list of tasks with or without each task's detailed contents. Then set your paper size, margins, and other printing attributes, and print the list.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_close_a_list.htm.title: How to close an inactive list temporarily?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_close_a_list.htm.body:
How to close an inactive lists so they don't appear on the sidebar?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the "···" button in the sidebar to the right of each list's name. (Note that this button is hidden until the mouse hovers over it. When the mouse is not hovering over it, it shows a number indicating the total tasks contained in the list).

Click "Close", then click "OK" for confirmation.


Closing inactive lists helps streamline your TickTick homepage sidebar and improve TickTick's performance. If you don't want to delete the list, closing it will save its contents in TickTick. However, please note that tasks on closed lists will not be displayed in "All", "Today", "Next 7 Days" or search results. In addition, you will not be reminded of tasks in a closed list.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_delete_a_list.ht.title: How to delete a list?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_delete_a_list.ht.body:
How to delete a list?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the "···" button in the sidebar to the right of each list's name. (Note that this button is hidden until the mouse hovers over it. When the mouse is not hovering over it, it shows a number indicating the total tasks contained in the list).

Click "Delete", then click "delete" in the confirmation window.


Note: once a list is deleted, all tasks within that list will be removed and are not recoverable, unless you have made a backup copy of your TickTick that contains that exact same list.

ticktick_web_app/what_is_inbox.html.title: What is "Inbox"?
ticktick_web_app/what_is_inbox.html.body:
What is "Inbox"?
"Inbox" is a predefined list, which can not be deleted. It works like a temporary storage box to store all tasks that have not yet been assigned to a specific list.

how-to-add-a-task.html.title: How to add a task?
how-to-add-a-task.html.body:
How to add a task?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.
You can choose to enter a task at the input box where "Add Task to Inbox" shows, or click the left sidebar to choose another list.
Type the task name.
Press Enter to save.

how_to_use_smart_date_parsing_when_addin.title: How to use Smart Date Parsing when adding tasks?
how_to_use_smart_date_parsing_when_addin.body:
How to use Smart Date Parsing when adding tasks?
Date & time information you type in the name of your task will be recognized as the due date and a reminder will automatically be set.
For example, if you want to go to library on July 30 at 2:00 p.m., you just need to type: "Go to library July 30 2 pm" when naming this task. TickTick will automatically recognize July 30 as the task’s due date and will set a reminder for 2:00 p.m. on that date.

How to remove date & time info from task content when using Smart Date Parsing?
If you prefer date and time not showing in your task content after you create a task, click Settings then choose "Remove Text in Tasks" from the "Smart Date Parsing" drop-down options.

how_to_add_reminders.html.title: How to add reminders ?
how_to_add_reminders.html.body:
How to add reminders ?

Sign in to TickTick on the web

Click the task's due date in the upper-left corner of the right panel.

Click time below the calendar to add a reminder time.



If you want to add more than one reminder to a task, click "On time". Then you can add reminders (for example, "5 minutes before","1 hour before","1 day before", etc. or "custom" set). Users of free TickTick accounts may add up to two reminders per task. Premium users are allowed a maximum of five reminders per task.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_add_a_recurring_.title: How to add a recurring task?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_add_a_recurring_.body:
How to add a recurring task?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click its due date in the upper-left corner of the right panel. 

Click the "Set Repeat" button.

Then you can choose a repeating mode such as Daily/Weekly/Monthly/Yearly. Or you can choose "Advanced" to set repeating interval and repeating type.




Advanced repeating mode



Repeating Interval
Mode




Daily
Every Day


Weekly
Repeat every N WeeksRepeat from Due date/Completion dateRepeat on S/M/T/W/T/F/S


Monthly
Repeat every N MonthsRepeat from Due date/Completion dateRepeat by day of the month/day of the week


Yearly
Repeat by the day of the year

ticktick_web_app/how_to_add_a_new_via_em.title: How to add a new task via email?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_add_a_new_via_em.body:
How to add a new task via email?
If your email inbox is full of to-dos, you can turn them into tasks using Mail Service in TickTick.

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of your TickTick homepage, then click "Settings" from the menu that appears. 

Click "Calendar & Mail" in the left panel.



Two separate email address appear at the bottom of the right panel.
1. todo@mail.ticktick.com.
If you sign into TickTick with a registered email address, you can email your task to todo@mail.ticktick.com via your registered email address.
2.todo+####@mail.ticktick.com.
This is a unique email address generated for your TickTick account (Note: click "Reset" to obtain a new address).  You can email your task to TickTick by using any email program to send your task to todo####@mail.ticktick.com.
The email subject line becomes the task name, while the items in the body of your email become the details appearing in the task . You can also add a date and reminder time to the email subject to cause TickTick to set a due date for your task on that date with that reminder. For example, you can write "Go to Starbucks with Frank tomorrow 4pm" or "Go shopping 2/4 4pm" in the subject, then you will find this task in TickTick’s "Inbox" with the same due dates and reminder times.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_create_checklist.title: How to create a checklist?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_create_checklist.body:
How to create a checklist?
Checklist functionality is frequently used to break a big task into some small ones such as arranging a family trip. Simply click on the button with three horizontal lines in the upper-right corner of the right panel and choose checklist view.

web-How_to_record_task_progress.html.title: How to check task progress?
web-How_to_record_task_progress.html.body:
How to check task progress?
To check your progress in completing tasks organized by checklist view, hover the cursor in the date section of the task (in the right pane). There you will see a vertical line representing the percentage of your task that is completed. Click the corresponding percent to confirm task progress.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_set_priority_of_.title: How to set priority of a task?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_set_priority_of_.body:
How to set priority of a task?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

2.1.For new tasks, click the "!!!" button, then choose a priority level for that task.

2.2. For existing tasks, click the "!!!" button at the top-right corner of the right pane, then choose a priority level for that task.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_upload_attachmen.title: How to upload attachment to a task?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_upload_attachmen.body:
How to upload attachments to a task?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the "···" in the bottom-right corner of the right pane.

Click "Upload" to add attachments.


Supported file types include Word, Excel, and various image files.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_print_a_task.htm.title: How to print a task?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_print_a_task.htm.body:
How to print a task?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the "···" in the bottom-right corner of the right pane.

Select "Print".

Set paper size, margins, etc. and print your task.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_assign_a_task_to.title: How to assign a task to others?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_assign_a_task_to.body:
How to assign a task?
In TickTick you can assign tasks in a shared list. The person you assign tasks to must first accept your invitation to a shared list before becoming responsible for that task.

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Choose a task in the shared list.

Click the assignment icon in the upper-right corner of the page to choose an assignee.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_comment_on_a_tas.title: How to comment on a task?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_comment_on_a_tas.body:
How to comment on a task?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Select a task, then click the Comment button at the bottom of the right panel.

Type a comment into the text field that appears above the Comment button.

Use "Comment" to add extra remarks to a task.


Within a shared list, all members can comment on any task. This enables more effective communication. If you want to send a shared member a message or reply a member in a shared list, you can type "@" to select a member or click the person's avatar to reply to someone directly.

The members you contact or reply to will receive immediate notification in their TickTick apps.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_check_revision_h.title: How to check task activities? (Premium)
ticktick_web_app/how_to_check_revision_h.body:
How to check task activities? (Premium)

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of your TickTick homepage, then click "Settings" from the menu that appears. 

Select "Labs" in the left panel and then enable "Task Activities" in the right panel.


Click "done" to return to your TickTick homepage, then click on any task, and click the "···" icon on the bottom of the right panel.

Choose "Task Activities" to check all modification records.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_add_tag_to_a_tas.title: How to add tags to a task?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_add_tag_to_a_tas.body:
How to add tags to a task?
Tags let you search across multiple lists for tasks that share common tags. This allows for a faceted search of your information. To activate this feature, you must first enable "Tags" in the "Labs" menu. Here's how:

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of your TickTick homepage, then click "Settings" from the menu that appears.

Click "Smart List" in the left panel, and enable "Tags" in the right panel.



To tag a task item, simply add a hashtag to a keyword in that item (for example, #Holiday). You may use a maximum of five tags per task.
You can view a list of the tags you've created in the "Tags" list in the sidebar.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_search_a_task.ht.title: How to search for a task?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_search_a_task.ht.body:
How to search for a task?
Click the magnifying glass in the sidebar on your TickTick homepage

P.S. Search function supports English only.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_move_a_task_in_a.title: How to move a task to another list ?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_move_a_task_in_a.body:
How to move a task to another list ?
Option 1

Sign in to TickTick on the web, then click on a task to see the task view in the right panel.

Click the "Inbox" icon at the bottom of the right panel.

Choose the list you want your task to be added to.



Option 2
Click on a task, drag it to the sidebar, and drop the task on top of the list you want it added to.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_import_tasks_fro.title: How to import tasks from other apps into TickTick?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_import_tasks_fro.body:
How to import tasks from other apps into TickTick?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of your TickTick homepage, then click "Settings" from the menu that appears.

Click "Backup" in the left panel, and click the "Import" link associated with the app file you want to import.


You can import tasks from apps such as Astrid, Wunderlist, and Toodledo.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_change_order_of_.title: How to change the order of the tasks ?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_change_order_of_.body:
How to change the order of the tasks?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click on a list, then click the "View" icon.

Choose the sorting view you prefer. Tasks in self-defined lists and in the "Inbox" are sortable by order, due date, title, and priority. Tasks in a shared list can be sorted by assignee. Tasks in the "All" list can be sorted by list.


Tasks in "Today" and "Next 7 Days" can't be sorted automatically. Instead you can drag and drop tasks to change their order.

ticktick_web_app/how_many_shortcuts_are_.title: What are the shortcuts in TickTick?
ticktick_web_app/how_many_shortcuts_are_.body:
What are the shortcuts in TickTick?

Sign in to TicKTick on the web.

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of your TickTick homepage, then click "Settings" from the menu that appears.

Click "Shortcuts" in the left panel.

how_to_duplicate_tasks.html.title: How to duplicate tasks?
how_to_duplicate_tasks.html.body:
How to duplicate tasks?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of your TickTick homepage, then click "Settings" from the menu that appears.3.

Click "Labs", then enable "Task Duplication".


Click "Done" and exit the settings so you can choose a task to duplicate.

Click "···" in the bottom-right corner of the list view page to choose "Duplicate" and a duplicate entry will be entered marked with the word "copy".



Change the date and time of the duplicate as appropriate.

how_to_set_snooze_time.html.title: How to set snooze time?
how_to_set_snooze_time.html.body:
How to set snooze time?
When you get a pop-up reminder with TickTick on the web , you can click snooze to have the reminder ring again at a short time later. Click snooze to select an existing snooze time, or click "Custom" to set it by yourself, or even choose another date.

how-to-create-reminder-for-subtask.html.title: How to create reminder for subtask?
how-to-create-reminder-for-subtask.html.body:
How to create reminder for subtask？
To create separate reminder for each subtask is an additional feature that available to TickTick Premium users only.

Open TickTick and select a task that contains subtasks
Move your cursor hovers over a subtask
Click the "alarm" icon and create a reminder for this individual subtask
Select another subtask and repeat step 3 to create another reminder

how-to-add-a-duration-to-task.html.title: How to add a duration to task?
how-to-add-a-duration-to-task.html.body:
How to add a duration to task?
With "Time Duration" function, you can set both start time and end time to a task. It supports for tasks that cost two or more days as well.
Sign in to TickTick -> Click a task to its details view -> Tap the time info at the top -> Tap Date to switch to Duration ->Tap Time to select normal/advanced options  
P.S.
Normal mode: set time duration within one day
Advanced mode: custom both start time and end time (no limitation)

ticktick_web_app/how_to_subscribe_tickti.title: How to subscribe to TickTick in your own calendar app?
ticktick_web_app/how_to_subscribe_tickti.body:
How to subscribe to TickTick in your own calendar app?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of your TickTick homepage, then click "Settings" from the menu that appears.

Click "Calendar & Mail" in the left panel.

Enable the URL" in the section of "Subscribe TickTick in your calendar app".

Add the provided URL to your calendar apps.

ticktick_web_app/how_to_subscribe_my_cal.title: How to subscribe to your calendar in TickTick? (Premium)
ticktick_web_app/how_to_subscribe_my_cal.body:
How to subscribe to your calendar in TickTick? (Premium)
This feature allows you to add events from a third-party calendar to TickTick.
How to do?

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of your Ticktick homepage, then select "Settings".

Click "Calendar & Mail" in the left panel and then click "Add by URL" in the right panel.

Enter the calendar URL from a third-party calendar app in the text entry field.

ticktick_web_app/what_is_calendar_view.h.title: What is "Calendar View"? (Premium)
ticktick_web_app/what_is_calendar_view.h.body:
What is "Calendar View"? (Premium)
The Calendar View presents your tasks in a traditional calendar view instead of in a vertical list of task items.
How to enable "Calendar View"?

Sign in to TickTick on the web.

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of your TickTick homepage, then click "Settings" from the menu that appears. 

Click "Smart List" in the left panel, and choose "Show" Calendar in the right panel. 

The "Calendar" list will be displayed below "Next 7 Days". 


You can drag and drop a task from one date to another date. You can click a task to edit it or click a date to add a new task.

ticktick_web_app/what_is_mini_calendar.h.title: What is "Mini Calendar"? (Premium)
ticktick_web_app/what_is_mini_calendar.h.body:
What is "Mini Calendar"? (Premium)
"Mini Calendar" is a small monthly calendar that, when enabled, appears at the bottom of the sidebar.

Click the avatar in the upper-left corner of your TickTick homepage, then click "Settings".

Click "Labs" in the left panel and then enable "Mini Calendar" in the right panel.


A small calendar will be displayed at the bottom of the left panel.



What is Mini Calendar used for?
Tip 1: The dates highlighted in yellow indicate that you have tasks on those days.
Tip 2: If you click a date on the Mini Calendar, tasks on that day will be displayed in the middle of the page.
Tip 3: You can click a date and create tasks for that day directly.
Tip 4. To display or hide the Mini Calendar, click the small button on the top center of the Mini Calendar.

android_app/1_how_can_i_get_the_ticktick.title: How to get the TickTick Android app?
android_app/1_how_can_i_get_the_ticktick.body:
How to get the TickTick Android app?
To download & install the TickTick Android app, search "TickTick" on Google Play, or tap on this link directly.

android_app/2_how_to_sign_in.html.title: How to sign in?
android_app/2_how_to_sign_in.html.body:
How to sign in?
You can sign in with your gmail, Google+, Facebook, or Twitter account directly, or sign up for a new account with a valid email address.
If you would like to try the TickTick Android app before registering an account, tap "Try" and familiarize yourself with the app. But be aware that your tasks cannot be synced until you use a registered account.

android_app/3_how_to_sign_out.html.title: How to sign out?
android_app/3_how_to_sign_out.html.body:
How to sign out?
Please note that if you sign out of your account, you need to sign in again the next time you open TickTick.

Slide the screen to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner of the screen. Then tap your avatar in the upper-left corner.

Tap the button in the upper-right corner (with the three vertical dots), and then tap "Sign Out".

android_app/4_how_should_i_do_if_i_forgo.title: What should I do if I forgot my password?
android_app/4_how_should_i_do_if_i_forgo.body:
What should I do if I forgot my password?

On the sign-in page, tap "Forgot Password".

A new page will appear asking for your email address, so enter your email address in the text field.

Tap "Reset Password" and an email will be sent to the email address you entered in the text field.

Check your email and follow the instructions to retrieve your password.

android_app/5_how_to_upgrade_torenew_pro.title: How to upgrade to/renew a Premium account?
android_app/5_how_to_upgrade_torenew_pro.body:
How to upgrade to/renew a Premium account?

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap your avatar in the upper-left corner to enter account details.

Tap "Upgrade to Premium", then select the monthly fee ($2.79) or the annual fee ($27.99) to complete your Premium subscription via Paypal.

android_app/how_to_edit_my_account_infor.title: How to edit my account information?
android_app/how_to_edit_my_account_infor.body:
How to edit my account information?

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap your avatar in the upper-left corner to enter account details.

You can change your avatar, name, email address, and password here.

android_app/how_should_i_do_if_i_still_c.title: Can't use premium features after upgrading TickTick?
android_app/how_should_i_do_if_i_still_c.body:
Can’t use premium features after upgrading TickTick?
Upon completion of your payment, normally you can enjoy the premium features. If not, restore TickTick, as follows.

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap your avatar in the upper-left corner to enter your account details.

Tap"My Pro", then tap "Restore" at the bottom of the new page.


If "Restore" doesn't work, please do not hesitate to contact us at support@ticktick.com

android_app/6_how_to_lock_the_app.html.title: How to lock the app for privacy?
android_app/6_how_to_lock_the_app.html.body:
How to lock the app for privacy?
To enhance the privacy of your data in TickTick, use the Lock feature.

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper right corner.

Tap "Security & Data" to enable Pattern Lock.

Trace an unlock pattern twice to set a pattern lock for TickTick.

android_app/7_how_to_choose_app_theme.ht.title: How to change themes?
android_app/7_how_to_choose_app_theme.ht.body:
How to change themes?
TickTick for Android gives you a choice of themes between various colors and other scenes.

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Theme" to select a theme.

android_app/how_to_change_font_size.html.title: How to adjust font size?
android_app/how_to_change_font_size.html.body:
How to adjust font size?
TickTick has two font sizes: Normal and Large.

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper right corner.

Tap "General", then tap "Font size" to select normal or large font size.

how_to_set_language.html.title: How to set language?
how_to_set_language.html.body:
How to set language in TickTick?

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper right corner.

Tap "General", then tap "Language".


There are more than 20 languages in TickTick for Android. Most of the languages were translated by our users. TickTick would not be the multi-language app that it is without users’ continued help and contributions. If you are interested in helping us with translation, please do not hesitate to let us know.)

android_app/how_many_default_lists_are_t.title: How to show or hide Smart Lists  in TickTick?
android_app/how_many_default_lists_are_t.body:
How to show or hide Smart Lists in TickTick?
Ticktick comes with nine predefined lists: Inbox, All, Today, Next 7 Days, Assigned to me, Calendar, Completed, Tags, and Trash. Some are hidden by default but you can make them visible. Here's how:

For example, the "Completed" list:

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap "Manage List" at the bottom of the list menu.

Tap "Smart List" in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Completed", then tap "Show".


You can show or hide any list using this procedure, except for the Inbox List. The Inbox List cannot be hidden.

how_to_create_custom_smart_list_android..title: How to create Custom Smart List? (Premium)
how_to_create_custom_smart_list_android..body:
How to create a Custom Smart List?(Premium)

Open TickTick on your Android device

Tap "Manage List" at the bottom of the leftside list menu.

Tap "Smart List" in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Add Smart List"

android_app/1_how_to_create_a_task_list..title: How to create a task list?
android_app/1_how_to_create_a_task_list..body:
How to create a task list?

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap "Add a list " at the bottom of list menu.

Enter a name for your list, then choose a color. This menu also lets you assign the new list to an existing folder or create a new folder in which to store it.

android_app/2_how_to_editrenamedelete_a_.title: How to edit lists and folders?
android_app/2_how_to_editrenamedelete_a_.body:
How to edit lists and folders?

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap "List" in the upper-left corner or slide the screen to the right.

Tap on the list or folder you want to edit.

how_to_send_task_lists.html.title: How to send lists to other members?
how_to_send_task_lists.html.body:
How to send lists to other members?

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap the list you want to share, then tap the menu button in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Share", then choose "Send as Text" or "Send as Image".

Choose from the assorted means for sending the task (for example, Google+, Twitter, Facebook Messenger, etc.).

android_app/4_how_to_share_a_task_list.h.title: How to share lists with other TickTick users?
android_app/4_how_to_share_a_task_list.h.body:
How to share lists with TickTick users?
Sharing lists is a great way to collaborate with friends, family, and colleagues and achieve your goals. TickTick provides this functionality. There are two ways to share lists.

Option 1: Add recipients

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap the list you want to share, then Tap "Share" from the option menu in the upper right corner. 

Tap "Invite new member".


Enter the email address, or name, of the TickTick user, then select that user from the name of existing TickTick members that should appear below. 




Option 2: Share via link

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap the list you want to share, then Tap "Share" from the option menu in the upper right corner. 

Tap "Invite new member", then tap "Link" in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Send the Link" and choose from among the many options TickTick gives you to send the link (for example, Gmail, Tweet, LinkedIn, Facebook Messenger, etc.).

android_app/how_to_accept_lists_from_oth.title: How to accept a shared list?
android_app/how_to_accept_lists_from_oth.body:
How to accept a shared list?
If a TickTick user shares a list with you, you will receive an invitation to join the shared list.

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap the envelope icon at the top, then tap on the unread invitation.

Choose "Accept" or "Decline".


If you accept a list, it will be added to your collection of lists in the sidebar menu.

android_app/5_how_to_change_the_order_of.title: How to reorder task lists?
android_app/5_how_to_change_the_order_of.body:
How to reorder task lists?

Open TickTick on your Android device.

Go to the leftside bar for task lists.

Tap the list you wish to sort, then drag & drop it to reorder it.

android_app/how-to-showhide-details.html.title: How to show/hide details?
android_app/how-to-showhide-details.html.body:
How to show/hide details?
You can choose to show/hide details in any List view, even in a Tag view too.
Click into a list -> Tap "..." icon at the top right hand -> select to show/hide details
By allowing to show details, the following information of each task will be shown :

Due date, if the task has

A alert icon, if the task has a reminder

A repeat icon, if the task is set to be repeated

An attachment icon, if the task has attachment

Its parent list

Progress Pie chart indicates the progress of subtasks underneath this task (not shown if none of the subtasks has been done yet)

the FIRST subtask ONLY.


Note: This feature is not available on the web.

android_app/1_how_to_create_a_new_task.h.title: How to create a task?
android_app/1_how_to_create_a_new_task.h.body:
How to create a new task?
With TickTick, you have six different ways to add a new task, giving you the power to choose a method that works best for you.
Option 1: Add a task to the Quick Add Bar with a due date.
"Quick add" is enabled by default, you can create a task by typing at the bottom of the task page (or by tapping the microphone icon to use voice input - see Option 5 below). Choose a due date and time by tapping the calendar icon.

Smart Date Parsing when adding tasks from Quick Add bar
If you type or say the date and time information for your task when using the Quick Add bar, TickTick will automatically set the date you gave as due date and set the time you gave as the time for that task to occur.
For example, if you want to go to library on next Saturday at 2 pm, you just need to type: "Go to library next Saturday 2 pm", then TickTick will automatically recognize the date of next Saturday as the task’s due date and set 2 pm as its reminder.

You can also select a list to add your new task to when using the Quick Add Bar. Tap the icon marked "Inbox" above the Quick Add Bar and select a list from the choices given or create a new list.  

Note: Can’t see quick add bar, only a "+" icon?
Go to "Advanced Settings" -> "Quick Add" -> Double check whether you’ve enabled it
Remove date & time info from task content when using Smart Date Parsing
If you prefer date and time not showing in your task content after your task is created, tap Settings > Advanced Settings > Smart Date Parsing, then select "Remove Text in Tasks"
After "Remove Text in Tasks" is enabled, the highlighted date & time text will be removed from the text of your task.

Option 2: Click "+" to add a task
1.Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.
2.Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper-right corner.
3.Tap "Advanced Settings", then select "Quick Add" to deactivate it. Now a circular button with the "+" character in its center will appear in the lower-right corner in task view. Click on the button to add a new task.


Option 3: Add a task from "Status Bar".
The Status Bar is a persistent notification bar that appears in your phone's main dropdown menu. You can add a new task directly to TickTick this way. To enable "Status Bar", You should:

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Advanced Settings", the select "Status Bar" to enable it.


The Status Bar is in the pull-down menu of your phone. Click "+" on the Status Bar to add a task without having to open the Ticktick app.
Option 4: Add a task from widget (turn to 3.6.4 for details).
Tasks in the "Completed" list are sorted by completion date. If you want to view completed tasks in a specific list, you can tap the funnel-shaped icon in the upper-right corner to select a list. Dates at left are completion dates while dates at right are due dates.
Option 5: Add a task by voice input.
Click the microphone button in the bottom-right corner, then tap and hold the "Hold to Talk" button to speak. If you state a date and time, TickTick will schedule your new task for that same date and time.

Option 6: Add a task by "note to self" voice command with Google Now.

Make sure the Google Now app is loaded on your smartphone or tablet.

Hit the microphone icon on the search widget to initiate a voice-based search.

Start by saying "note to self". For example, you can say "note to self, have lunch with Jack tomorrow at 1 pm."

Select TickTick to save the task.

android_app/how_to_create_checklists_in_.title: How to create checklists?
android_app/how_to_create_checklists_in_.body:
How to create checklists?

Open TickTick on your Android device, and detail page.

Tap the option menu in the upper-right corner to select Checklist.


Checklists are useful for tasks requiring verification of completion, like shopping and packing lists. One click on the checklist item marks that item as completed. For example, as you place a grocery item in your grocery basket, you can then mark that item as completed. Individual checklist items cannot be assigned individual due dates, but the entire checklist can have a due date.

How to add description to a task with checklists?（Premium only)
If you have a TickTick Premium account, you can add a description to a checklist to add more detail. For example, if you have trouble remembering to ask for a receipt, you could type "don't forget a receipt" into the description line under the name of your shopping checklist.

how_to_record_task_progress_android.html.title: How to check task progress?
how_to_record_task_progress_android.html.body:
How to check task progress?

Tap a task title to enter the task's detail page.

Press on the date section of the screen to bring up a shaded progress bar which you can slide from 0% to 100% to easily record what you think the level of progress on that task is.


Note, if the task contains a checklist, progress will be automatically recorded based on the percentage of items marked completed. For example, a checklist with 2 items unchecked and 1 item checked off as completed will show 33% progress.

android_app/2_how_to_batch_edit_tasks.ht.title: How to batch edit tasks?
android_app/2_how_to_batch_edit_tasks.ht.body:
How to batch edit tasks?
Batch editing applies to all of the tasks you selected. Batch editing allows you to apply a new due date and time, move tasks to another list, delete tasks, set a priority level for the tasks, send someone a list of your selected tasks, and merge the selected tasks into one task.

Open TickTick on your Android device, and bring up a task view page.

Long press a task, then tap on any other tasks you want to batch edit.

Choose an option at the top of the screen (for example, delete the batch of tasks by tapping the Trash Can button).

android_app/3_how_to_change_the_order_of.title: How to change the order of the tasks?
android_app/3_how_to_change_the_order_of.body:
How to change the order of tasks?

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap the list you wish to sort, then tap the option menu in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Sort" and choose a sorting filter. All lists can be sorted by the due date, title, and priority of tasks inside the list. Tasks in the "All", "Today", and "Next 7 Days" lists can also be sorted by list name.





Drag tasks to change their order:

Sort tasks by "Custom". (This is the default sorting filter.)

Tap and hold a task to drag it up or down, then release your finger when the task is where you want it to be in the list.

android_app/how_to_set_recurring_tasks.h.title: How to set recurring tasks?
android_app/how_to_set_recurring_tasks.h.body:
How to set recurring tasks?
After you check off a recurring task, the task will reappear on the next date set for recurrence. TickTick offers default and custom repeat modes.

What’s the difference between Defulat repeat mode and Custom repeat mode?
Default repeat mode reschedules the repeat task in the future based on the original time interval chosen. Custom repeat mode provides more flexibility and can reschedule in the past. Here is an example:
For example, a recurring task with a due date of June 15 repeating every 2 days. But you didn't check it off until Jun 18.
1.Default repeat mode: the next recurring date is Jun 19.
In Default repeat mode, if you check the task off on June 15 (the first due date), the next recurring date should be Jun 17 (two days from June 15), and then June 19, June 21, etc. in two-day intervals. But if you check it off on Jun 18 which is after its next recurring date Jun 17, the next scheduled task will be in the future. In this case: Jun 19.

2.Custom repeat mode:

1. Repeat from Due Date: the next recurring date is Jun 17.
No matter when you check off this task, it will roll to the next recurring date, even though the next recurring date is in the past.

2. Repeat from Completion Date: the next recurring date is Jun 20.
This repeat mode is totally based on your completion date and repeating intervals, regardless of your due date.

android_app/4_how_to_archive_tasks.html.title: How to hide or show completed tasks?
android_app/4_how_to_archive_tasks.html.body:
How to hide or show completed tasks?
Completed tasks are displayed at the bottom of each list in faded text. To hide or show completed tasks, you can tap the option menu in the upper-right corner and tap "Hide Completed" or "Show Completed".

android_app/11_how_to_check_completed_ta.title: Where can I view my completed tasks?
android_app/11_how_to_check_completed_ta.body:
Where can I view my completed tasks?
You can check all your completed tasks in the "Completed" list, which is hidden by default. Please see section 3.2.1 to learn how to show the "Completed" list in TickTick.
Tap the "Completed" list in the sidebar menu. Tasks in the "Completed" list are sorted by completion date. If you are viewing the "Completed" list and you want to view completed tasks in a specific list, simply tap the funnel-shaped icon in the upper-right corner to select a list. Dates appearing on the left are completion dates, and dates on the right are the due dates.

android_app/7_how_to_set_default_due_dat.title: How to set default attributes of a new task ?
android_app/7_how_to_set_default_due_dat.body:
How to set default attributes of a new task ?
If you want to set a specific due date, priority level, and/or reminder every time you create a new task, you can set "New Task Defaults" in TickTick. Here's how:

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Advanced Settings", then tap "New Task Defaults".

Set the default values such as priority, due date, and reminder time for new tasks.

android_app/8_how_to_swipe_tasks_for_qui.title: How to swipe tasks for quick actions?
android_app/8_how_to_swipe_tasks_for_qui.body:
How to swipe tasks for quick actions?
Sliding a task left or right causes four actions to occur. Each action has its own color. Here are the actions, colors, and ways to swipe:

To set a due date, Slowly swipe the task to the left, and release when yellow appears.

To move a task to another list, slowly swipe the task to the left until blue appears.

To mark a task as completed, slowly swipe the task to the right until green appears.

To set priority for a task, swipe the task to the right, and release when orange appears.

android_app/10_how_to_upload_attachment..title: How to upload an attachment to a task?
android_app/10_how_to_upload_attachment..body:
How to upload an attachment to a task?

Open TickTick on your Android device, and enter a task.

Tap the option menu in the upper-right corner, then tap "Attachment".


You can add images, audios, videos or other regular files to a task. If the task is stored in a shared list, all members of the list can view and save any such files attached thereto.

android_app/12_how_to_add_tags_to_a_task.title: How to add tags to a task?
android_app/12_how_to_add_tags_to_a_task.body:
How to add tags to a task?
The "Tags" list helps you filter and find similar tasks in TickTick. The "Tags" list is hidden by default. For more details about how to enable the "Tags" list, please see section 3.2.1.
You can attach at most five tags per task. To tag a task, simply add a hashtag to a keyword (for example, "#office"). Then just add the word "#office" to all tasks that you believe should be labeled with the "office" tag. In the list menu you can search the Tags lists to see all the tasks that have been labeled with a specific tag.

how_to_send_a_task.html.title: How to send a task?
how_to_send_a_task.html.body:
How to send a task?

Tap on the task you want to send.

Tap "Send" from the option menu in the upper-right corner.

Choose "Send as Text" or "Send as Image".

Choose the means by which you will send the task (for example, email, Google+, Twitter, Facebook Messenger, etc.).

android_app/how_to_search_a_task.html.title: How to search for a task?
android_app/how_to_search_a_task.html.body:
How to search for a task?

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap on the magnifying glass icon, then type in your search term and any matching tasks will appear below.

android_app/13how_to_add_comment_on_a_ta.title: How to add comment on a task?
android_app/13how_to_add_comment_on_a_ta.body:
How to add comment on a task?

Open TickTick on your android device.

Go to a task's detail page, then tap on the option menu in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Comment" and enter a comment. If the task you commented on is in a shared list, all members can view your comment and make their own comments.


The "Comment" feature is used to add extra remarks to a task. Within a shared list, all shared members can comment on any tasks to realize real-time chat and communication. If you want to reply to someone in a shared list, you can enter "@" to select a member, or tap the member's icon to reply to that person directly.


The member you reply to will receive immediate notification in TickTick.

android_app/how_to_assign_a_task_list.ht.title: How to assign a task?
android_app/how_to_assign_a_task_list.ht.body:
How to assign a task to someone?
Please note that the person you want to assign a task to must accept your invitation to a shared list before TickTick assigns responsibility for that task to that person.

Open TickTick on your android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap on a shared list, then tap on the task you wish to assign to someone.

Tap the option menu in the upper-right corner, then choose "Assign to".




If you want to view all the tasks that are assigned to you, you can enable the predefined list "Assigned to me".

android_app/how-to-create-reminder-for-s.title: How to create reminder for subtask?
android_app/how-to-create-reminder-for-s.body:
How to create reminder for subtask？
To create separate reminder for each subtask is an additional feature that available to TickTick Premium users only  

Open TickTick and select a task that contains subtasks
Tap a subtask
Click the "alarm" icon and create a reminder for this individual subtask
Select another subtask and repeat step 3 to create another reminder

android_app/how-to-add-a-duration-to-tas.title: How to add a duration to task?
android_app/how-to-add-a-duration-to-tas.body:
How to add a duration to task?
With "Time Duration" function, you can set both start time and end time to a task. It supports for tasks that cost two or more days as well.
Sign in to TickTick -> Click a task to is details view -> Tap Date to switch to Duration ->Tap Time to select normal/advanced options
P.S.
Normal mode: set time duration within one day
Advanced mode: custom both start time and end time (no limitation)

what_is_calendar_view.html.title: What is Calendar View?
what_is_calendar_view.html.body:
What is Calendar View?

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap "Calendar".


Calendar View shows the traditional grid view of the days of the week so that you can quickly scan your week or month in one glance.

What’s special to Calendar View?

You can view tasks in month view, week view, 3-day view, today view, and list view.
Highlighted text indicates a task due on that date.
Click on a date to get a list of tasks for that particular date.

how_to_get_grid_view_of_calendar_android.title: How to get grid view of calendar?
how_to_get_grid_view_of_calendar_android.body:
How to get grid view of calendar?
Grid View
To switch to the grid view of the calendar, tap the option menu in the upper-right corner of the list view and choose "Grid View".

Show or hide future cycles for repeating tasks
Tap the option menu in the upper-right corner, then tap "Show All Repeat Cycles" to toggle between showing and hiding the repeat cycles.

android_app/1_how_to_display_local_calen.title: How to display local calendar events in TickTick?
android_app/1_how_to_display_local_calen.body:
How to show local calendar events in TickTick?

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Security & Data", then tap "Subscribe Calendar".

Enable "Subscribe Calendar", then select local calendars to be displayed in TickTick.

android_app/3_how_to_subscribe_other_cal.title: How to subscribe other calendar service? (Premium)
android_app/3_how_to_subscribe_other_cal.body:
How to subscribe other calendar service? (Premium)

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Security & Data", then tap "Subscribe Calendar".

Enable "Subscribe Calendar", then tap "+ Add Account", then tap the calendar you want to subscribe to or tap "Add URL" to enter a Calendar URL.

android_app/1_how_to_set_due_date_&_remi.title: How to add reminders to a task?
android_app/1_how_to_set_due_date_&_remi.body:
How to add reminders to a task?

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Enter a task detail page and tap the due date at the top of the page.

Tap the alarm clock icon to set a reminder time.


Preset reminder times include on time, 5 minutes before, 30 minutes before, 1 hour before, 1 day before, and 2 days before. Tap "+ Custom" to set a custom reminder. All new tasks have a default reminder of "on time" so that the reminder will occur at the same time as the time you set for that task to occur.

android_app/3_how_to_set_location_remind.title: How to set up location-based reminder ?
android_app/3_how_to_set_location_remind.body:
How to set up location-based reminder?

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Enter a task detail page and tap the option menu in the upper-right corner, then tap "Location".

Enter an address and choose to be reminded either upon arrival or leaving.


Your phone's location services (GPS) must be active for location-based reminders to function.

android_app/6_how_to_change_the_ringtone.title: How to set ringtone, annoying alert?
android_app/6_how_to_change_the_ringtone.body:
How to set reminder ringtone and annoying alert?
Reminder ringtones:

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Reminder", then tap "Ringtone" to select a reminder ringtone.


 
Annoying alert:
If "annoying alert" enabled, the alert will not go off in a minute and will be active again after two minutes until the notification has been handled.

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Reminder", then tap "Ringtone", then choose "annoying alert".

android_app/4_how_should_i_do_if_i_dont_.title: How to set up reminder pop-ups?
android_app/4_how_should_i_do_if_i_dont_.body:
How to set up reminder pop-ups?

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Reminder", then tap "Reminder pop-ups".



What is special about reminder pop-ups?
When getting a pop-up reminder, you can set custom snooze time. Tap snooze to select an existing snooze time, or tap "Custom" to set it by yourself, or even choose another date.

android_app/7_how_to_set_daily_alert.htm.title: How to set up "Daily Alert"?
android_app/7_how_to_set_daily_alert.htm.body:
How to set "Daily Alert"?
Daily Alert provides you with a daily summary of all the tasks you have scheduled for today. You choose when this alert occurs.

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Reminder", then tap "Daily Alert" to choose a time for the alert to occur.

android_app/8_how_to_enable_reminder_in_.title: What is "Status Bar"?
android_app/8_how_to_enable_reminder_in_.body:
How to use Status Bar?
The TickTick Status Bar appears in the standard pull-down screen of your Android phone. A message will appear showing today's tasks, and TickTick will open if you click on the message.
How to enable Status Bar?

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Advanced Settings", then tap "Status Bar" to activate it.


You can also change the font color for your Status Bar entries. There is an option directly below the "Status Bar" menu item.

How to make notifications stay on your Status Bar?
If you enable the "Stick on Status Bar" feature, notifications will stay on the status bar until you view, complete,or snooze the task.

Open TickTick on your Android device, then either swipe to the right or tap the hamburger button in the upper-left corner.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper-right corner.


3.Tap "Reminder", then tap "Stick on Status Bar".

android_app/1_why_i_cant_find_ticktick_w.title: Why I can’t find TickTick widgets?
android_app/1_why_i_cant_find_ticktick_w.body:
Why I can’t find TickTick widgets?
Please make sure your TickTick application has been properly installed on the internal storage of your Android phone, rather than on a removable SD card. After that, you can reboot your device for another try.

android_app/2_which_kind_of_widgets_does.title: Which kind of widgets does TickTick have?
android_app/2_which_kind_of_widgets_does.body:
Which kind of widgets does TickTick have?
The following widgets are available: TickTick views in 2×2, 4×2, 4×3, and 4x4;  TickTick Week view in 4×3; TickTick Shortcut view in 1×1; TickTick Undone view in 1×1. Choose a preferred widget according to your needs.

What is special to TickTick (Week) widget?
The interface of TickTick (week) widget is like Calendar View. The upper side of widget is a calendar in week view. Just tap a date, and tasks will be displayed in the lower side of the widget. You can tap left/right arrow to move to the last/next week, and tap the dot in the upper right hand corner of the widget to move back to this week.

android_app/3_how_to_configure_widget.ht.title: How to configure widgets?
android_app/3_how_to_configure_widget.ht.body:
How to configure widgets?
Before a widget can be displayed on your screen, you must first configure it. The widget can be reconfigured at anytime.

android_app/how_to_add_tasks_and_enter_t.title: How to add tasks and open TicKTick through widget?
android_app/how_to_add_tasks_and_enter_t.body:
How to add tasks and open TickTick through widget?
You can directly add tasks through all sizes of widgets without opening the TickTick app. Tap "+" in the upper right hand of the widget to create a task, then tap the send button to send the new task to TickTick.
Tap a specific task on the widget to enter its detail page, or click on any of the tasks to open a list view in TickTick.

whats_the_difference_between_ticktick_un.title: What’s the difference between TickTick Undone & TickTick Shortcut?
whats_the_difference_between_ticktick_un.body:
What’s the difference between TickTick Undone & TickTick Shortcut?
TickTick Undone 1x1 provides you with a count of the number of your overdue tasks plus today’s tasks. If your overdue & today’s tasks are more than 9, TickTick Undone will display 9+ instead of the actual number. TickTick Shortcut 1*1 is simply an icon you can place on your home screen for easy, one-tap access to your TickTick app.
P.S. Some android devices don't have TickTick Shortcut 1*1

ios_app/1_how_can_i_get_the_ticktick_iph.title: How to get the TickTick iphone app?
ios_app/1_how_can_i_get_the_ticktick_iph.body:
How to get the TickTick iPhone app?
To download & install the TickTick iPhone app, search "TickTick" on Apple's App Store, or tap on this link directly.

ios_app/2_how_to_sign_in.html.title: How to sign in?
ios_app/2_how_to_sign_in.html.body:
How to sign in?
Sign up with your Gmail, Facebook account, or any valid email address of yours. You can try TickTick without signing in by tapping the "Try" button. Please note that the trial version does not sync tasks because syncing requires you to first sign in.

ios_app/3_how_to_sign_out.html.title: How to sign out?
ios_app/3_how_to_sign_out.html.body:
How to sign out?

Slide the screen to the right.

Tap your avatar in the upper-left corner.

Tap "Sign Out" at the bottom of the page.

ios_app/4_how_should_i_do_if_i_forgot_my.title: Forgot your password?
ios_app/4_how_should_i_do_if_i_forgot_my.body:
Forgot your password?

Tap "Forgot Password" in the TickTick sign-in page.

When the Forgot Password page opens, enter your email address.

Tap "Reset Password" and TickTick will send an email to you with instructions.

Check your email and follow the instructions to retrieve your new password.

ios_app/5_how_to_upgrade_torenew_pro_acc.title: How to upgrade to\/renew a premium account?
ios_app/5_how_to_upgrade_torenew_pro_acc.body:
How to upgrade to/renew a premium account?

Open TickTick on your iOS device and slide the screen to the right.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Upgrade to Premium".


Select a monthly or annual account and follow the prompts to complete your purchase.

ios_app/how_to_edit_my_account_informati.title: How to edit my account information?
ios_app/how_to_edit_my_account_informati.body:
How to edit my account information?

Open TickTick on your iOS device and slide the screen to the right.

Tap your avatar in the upper-left corner.

Your options include: update your avatar by using a photo or taking a picture, use a nickname, and change your email address & password.

ios_app/how_should_i_do_if_i_still_cant_.title: Can't use premium features after purchasing?
ios_app/how_should_i_do_if_i_still_cant_.body:
Can't use premium features after purchasing?
Upon completion of your payment, normally you can enjoy premium features. But if you can’t, please try the following steps:

Open TickTick on your iOS device and slide the screen to the right.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Upgrade to Premium".

Tap "Restore Purchases" at the bottom of the page.


If the problem isn’t solved, please contact us via email: support@ticktick.com

ios_app/how_to_lock_the_app.html.title: How to lock the app?
ios_app/how_to_lock_the_app.html.body:
How to lock the app?
There are two options to lock TickTick: Passcode and Touch ID.
Option 1: Passcode

Open TickTick on your iOS device and slide the screen to the right.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Advanced Settings", then tap "Passcode".


Option 2: Touch ID
After you enable Passcode according to the steps above, you can then enable "Touch ID" in the same page.
Once Touch ID is enabled, the Touch ID sensor will read your fingerprint and unlock TickTick with a touch of your finger.

[installation_&_account].html.title: How to change the themes in TickTick?
[installation_&_account].html.body:
How to change themes in TickTick？

Open TickTick on your iOS device and slide the screen to the right.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Theme", then select a color or landscape scene.

ios_app/how_to_change_language_and_font_.title: How to change font size in TickTick？
ios_app/how_to_change_language_and_font_.body:
How to change font size in TickTick？

Open TickTick on your iOS device and slide the screen to the right.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Preferences", then tap "Font Size" to select standard or large

ios_app/what_does_the_app_badge_count_fo.title: What is the app badge count for?
ios_app/what_does_the_app_badge_count_fo.body:
What does the app badge count for?
The small red badge that hovers over the TickTick app icon counts the number of "Today & Overdue" tasks by default. You can choose the task types to be counted in the App Badge.

Open TickTick on your iOS device and slide the screen to the right.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Preferences" and then tap "App Badge" to choose the task type(s) you wish to include in the App Badge count.

how_to_set_language_for_ticktick.html.title: How to set language for TickTick?
how_to_set_language_for_ticktick.html.body:
How to set language for TickTick?
The TickTick app that you install comes with a default language. Other languages are available. Follow these instructions to set a different language for TickTick.

Open TickTick on your iOS deivce and slide the screen to the right.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Preferences", then tap "Language".

why_voice_input_cant_recognize_my_langua.title: Why voice input can't recognize my language?
why_voice_input_cant_recognize_my_langua.body:
Why voice input can't recognize my language?
If this issue happens, you should first check the advanced settings to see which voice typing language TickTick is currently using.

Open TickTick on your iOS device and slide the screen to the right.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper-right corner.

Tap "Advanced Settings", tap "Voice Input".

Select a voice typing language.

how_to_showhide_smart_lists.html.title: How to show/hide Smart Lists?
how_to_showhide_smart_lists.html.body:
How to show/hide Smart Lists ?
There are 7 default lists in TickTick: All, Today, Next 7 Days, Assigned to me, Calendar, Tags, Completed. Some of them are hidden by default, and you can enable them by the following steps:
Take "Completed" as an example:

Open TickTick on your iOS device and slide the screen to the right.

Click the gear-shaped icon in the upper right corner.

Tap "Smart List".

Enable "Completed"(choose "show").

how_to_create_custom_smart_list_ios.html.title: How to create a Custom Smart List? (Premium)
how_to_create_custom_smart_list_ios.html.body:
How to create a Custom Smart List? (Premium)

Open TickTick on your iOS device and slide the screen to the right.

Click the gear-shaped icon in the upper right corner, then tap "Smart List".

Tap "Custom" at the bottom of the screen to add a custom Smart List.



You can sort items by List, Tag, Date, Priority, Assignee. These Filters are flexible enough to help you generate your own Smart List.
If you need to focus on only items you marked with high priority in TickTick, just choose "High priority", "Today", and "Tomorrow" in the Smart List filters menu to create a custom smart list which you can name "High Priority" or some similar name.

Delete a Custom Smart List:

Open TickTick on your iOS device and slide the screen to the right.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper right corner, then tap "Smart List".

Select the Custom Smart List you want to delete.

Tap "Delete Smart List" at the bottom of the screen.

how_to_create_task_lists.html.title: How to create task lists?
how_to_create_task_lists.html.body:
How to create task lists?

Open TickTick on your iOS device and slide the screen to the right.

Tap "Add List" at the bottom of the screen.

Enter a name for your new list, then tap "Done".

How_to_create_list_folders.html.title: How to create folders for lists?
How_to_create_list_folders.html.body:
How to create list folders?
With Folders, organizing your lists is as simple as drag-and-drop.
1.Open TickTick on your iOS device. +
2.Drag a list on top of another that you’d like to include in the same folder.
3.Hover your selected list until a blue box appears around the second list.
4.Drop the selected list, and then you can enter a name for the folder.

how_to_edit_lists_and_folders.html.title: How to edit lists and folders?
how_to_edit_lists_and_folders.html.body:
How to edit lists and folders?

Open TickTick on your iOS device and slide the screen to the right.

Swipe a list or folder to the left.

Tap "Edit"to edit the list or folder.

how_to_share_task_lists.html.title: How to share task lists?
how_to_share_task_lists.html.body:
How to share task lists?
With a shared list, it is easy to check a shopping list with your family members or discuss a meeting agenda with your colleagues.
Option 1: Share via Email

Open TickTick on your iOS device and slide the screen to the right.

Tap on a list you want to share, then tap the option menu in the upper-right corner, then tap "Share".

Tap "Invite Member".

Enter your contact's email address, then tap "Done".



Option 2: Share via link

Open TickTick on your iOS device and slide the screen to the right.

Tap on a list you want to share, then tap the option menu in the upper-right corner, then tap "Share".

Tap "Invite Member".

Tap "Link" beside "Contacts", then tap "Send the link".

Select an app to share the link with others. Other options include "Assign to Contact", "Copy", and "Print".


If your invitees follow the link, TickTick will send a notification to you asking whether you want to share the list with them. If you agree, the list will be shared and copied to their TickTick accounts automatically.

how_to_accept_a_shared_list.html.title: How to accept a shared list?
how_to_accept_a_shared_list.html.body:
How to accept a shared list?
If someone shares a list with you, you will receive an invitation to accept the shared list.

Open TickTick on your iOS device and slide the screen to the right.

Tap the envelope icon at the top of the screen. Tap "Accept" to accept the invitation or "Decline" to reject the invitation.


After accepting a shared list, it will be automatically added as a list in your TickTick.

how-to-showhide-details.html.title: How to show/hide details?
how-to-showhide-details.html.body:
How to show/hide details?
You can choose to show/hide details in any List view, even in a Tag view too.
Click into a list -> Tap "..." icon at the top right hand -> select to show/hide details
By allowing to show details, the following information of each task will be shown :

Due date, if the task has

A alert icon, if the task has a reminder

A repeat icon, if the task is set to be repeated

An attachment icon, if the task has attachment

Its parent list

Progress Pie chart indicates the progress of subtasks underneath this task (not shown if none of the subtasks has been done yet)

the FIRST subtask ONLY.


    

    

    

Note: This feature is not available on the web.

ios_app/1how_to_create_a_new_task_md.htm.title: How to create a new task?
ios_app/1how_to_create_a_new_task_md.htm.body:
How to create a new task?
TickTick gives you five different ways to create new tasks: The Add Button, Quick Add, Pull-Down Screen, Voice Input, and Siri Integration.
Option 1: Add Button (default method)

Open TickTick on your iOS device and slide the screen to the right.

Tap on a list you want to share, then tap on the "+" symbol at the bottom of the list to add a new item.


Option 2: Quick Add

Open TickTick on your iOS device and slide the screen to the right.

Tap the gear-shaped icon in the upper right corner, then tap "Advanced Settings".
